abstract: An injective coloring of a graph is a vertex coloring where two vertices have distinct colors if a path of length two exists between them. Let χ i (G) be the injective chromatic number of a graph G. In this paper, we investigate the injective coloring of planar graphs with girth 6. We improve some results of Borodin and Ivanova (2011) [1], Doyon et al. (2010) [4] and Li and Xu (2012) [6] by showing that if G is a planar graph with girth at least 6, then (1) χ i (G) ≤ ∆ + 3; (2) χ i (G) ≤ ∆ + 2 if ∆ ≥ 9; (3) χ i (G) ≤ ∆ + 1 if ∆ ≥ 17.
